text: has renamed the channel from "local-dev-beta" to "local-development"
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1582726897004100>

Additionally, in the near future, we plan to raise the minimum required version of node from V8 to v10. To check which version of node you are on, run `node -v`. You can upgrade by downloading a new version from the node homepage <https://nodejs.org/en/>.

text:
set the channel topic: A channel to discuss local development on the HubSpot CMS.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development>
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development-reference>
<@UGGC62M7D> Getting an error on update.

```npm WARN deprecated request@2.88.2: request has been deprecated, see <https://github.com/request/request/issues/31>
42
npm ERR! code EEXIST
npm ERR! syscall symlink
npm ERR! path ../lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cms-cli/bin/hs.js
npm ERR! dest /usr/local/bin/hs
npm ERR! errno -17
npm ERR! EEXIST: file already exists, symlink '../lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cms-cli/bin/hs.js' -> '/usr/local/bin
/hs'
npm ERR! File exists: /usr/local/bin/hs
npm ERR! Remove the existing file and try again, or run npm
npm ERR! with --force to overwrite files recklessly.```
<@U22VBL87M> <@UQ4ED6QFM> any thoughts on this error?
I haven't seen that one before, let me see what I can find
I can update it if I manually -rm the original files, but that's probably not the way y'all want the update process to go.
Correct, you shouldn't need to do that at all. Did you run `npm i -g`?
`npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest` is what i ran
npm is installed through homebrew if that helps

i don't normally have issues installing packages globally. the only time i've ever run into a symlink issue is when i stupidly tried updating npm without using homebrew, but that seems irrelevant here.
can you run `ls -lah /usr/local/bin/hs`?

i've already fixed it, so i'm not sure that's going to do anything for you, but here is the response
```lrwxr-xr-x  1 admin  admin    46B Feb 26 09:49 /usr/local/bin/hs -> ../lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cms-cli/bin/hs.js```
i can try to do the update again and see if it breaks
yeah, it is fine now. want me to downgrade and try the update again?

ok, so the response when broken is this
```lrwxr-xr-x  1 admin  admin    66B Feb  6 11:13 /usr/local/bin/hs -> ../../../Users/corydymond/.config/yarn/global/node_modules/.bin/hs```
i think the issue is that it was installed via `yarn` and then the upgrade was attempting to install via `npm`
and `npm` isn’t aware of `yarn` so it won’t touch the symlink
that seems probable, but i don't know why i would have installed it via yarn? i would've almost certainly just done what your docs said. did the old docs specify to use yarn?

yup. `yarn global add @HubSpot/cms-cli@latest` works perfectly. i'm swapping over to npm so i don't have this issue in the future, but you may want to add something in the docs to say if you're upgrading and originally used yarn, you will need to use that.
<@U6W3H6YN8> this key is on a per account basis?

i created my dev account with my google auth, but cant seem to connect to HubSpot FTP
I'm using my the email and password on my google account , what am i missing?
Yep!
herm
Are you running into an issue <@U38EZFVFE>?
nope. I upgraded the cli and i was just currious.
